website_summaries.verdict: At almost 6-feet tall, this revolving bookcase is a real space-saver.
pros: This media tower holds small books well and stands 56 inches tall
The shelf rotates 360 degrees smoothly, and the shelves are adjustable to accommodate different height books
The compact design can hold a surprising number of books or Blu-Ray cases
cons: The instructions are challenging, and the shelves are made of standard particle board

customer_reviews.title: AND WOULD
customer_reviews.text: This was easy but time consuming to put together....most of the time spent was inserting the little metal shelf holders into the slots so I could slide the shelves where I wanted them. It holds approximately 288 individual dvd cases. i used this as an over flow from another dvd cabinet, so what you see in the picture is not 288...but each shelf holds 12 dvds and there are 24 shelves. I like it and would recommend it...it's good for the price. I'm not sure about VHS tapes....below is pic of how much space is left at the top of each shelf with my dvds on them.

customer_reviews.title: High price considering the marginal quality of materials
customer_reviews.text: Unit is of marginal quality for the price. Not every piece fits well. Instructions are 95% by illustration with a few sentences where extra caution is necessary. Most of the fasteners are very special types. Parts were all there with NO extras of unique critical pieces that you WILL NOT find at home depot. Pay close attention to orientation of red marked ends and blue marked ends.
customer_reviews.author: Mike of Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Great space-saving option!
customer_reviews.text: This spinning DVD rack does exactly what I wanted it to: holds my massive DVD collection without taking up a mass of space. I was able to fit approximately 2 1/2 bins full of DVDs on the rack. It spins like it’s supposed to and was easy to put together (and I’m definitely not Bob the Builder). The instructions include diagrams my 5 year old could decipher. Simple. Please keep in mind this thing is made of particle board (which I fully expected upon purchase), so don’t bang it up against anything while building it. My only problem is I like it so much I need another one to hold my CDs and games!
customer_reviews.author: Syndirela

customer_reviews.title: Great DVD storage/display

Mine are in alphabetical order so it is easy for me to guess what is hidden there but I can see it frustrating others.

customer_reviews.title: don't be put off by the thought of assembling it

No, the instructions aren't foolproof, but they're good enough, especially if you don't mind doing some test fitting and giving the matter some thought. No special tools required, no DIY experience necessary. BTW the base that comes with the kit seems plenty sturdy, but if you're using this to display your anvils, by all means go with the upgrade.
